item.title: Nicole add a quote by David Brin
item.description: "It is said that power corrupts, but actually it's more true that power attracts the corruptible. The sane are usually attracted by other things than power." -- David Brin

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Consistency is contrary to nature, contrary to life. The only completely consistent people are the dead." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Tennyson, Alfred
item.description: "Yet all experience is an arch wherethrough Gleams that untraveled world whose margin fades Forever and forever when I move. How dull it is to pause, to make an end, To rust unburnished, not to shine in use! As though to breathe were life!" -- Tennyson, Alfred

item.title: Nicole add a quote by NMFN
item.description: "Life is plentiful and easily squandered but never cheap." -- NMFN

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Aldo Leopold
item.description: "The last word in ignorance is the man who says of an animal or plant, "What good is it?" If the land mechanism as a whole is good, then every part is good, whether we understand it or not. If the biota, in the course of aeons, has built something we like but do not understand, then who but a fool would discard seemingly useless parts? To keep every cog and wheel is the first precaution of intelligent tinkering." -- Aldo Leopold

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Aldo Leopold
item.description: "Conservation is getting nowhere because it is incompatible with our Abrahamic concept of land. We abuse land because we regard it as a commodity belonging to us. When we see land as a community to which we belong, we may begin to use it with love and respect." -- Aldo Leopold

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Silas Sparkhammer
item.description: "For me, religion is like a rhinoceros: I don't have one, and I'd really prefer not to be trampled by yours." -- Silas Sparkhammer
